best.why: It matches the manifesto's established voice exactly: declarative, compressed, no wasted breath. Each sentence earns the next. The three-beat catalog (image, essay, song) escalates without overstaying. 'Smoothness is not a failure of technology. It is technology applied without resistance.' is the sharpest formulation of the idea — it reframes rather than merely accuses, which is what the manifesto does at every turn. The riverbed closer lands clean because nothing before it has cluttered the runway.

worst.why: It bloats in the middle. 'Seamless Sovereigns,' 'algorithm-serf us,' 'virality's vomit over vision's vertigo' — this is a different writer's voice entirely: alliterative, maximalist, reaching for punk-poster rage where the manifesto has been earning its force through restraint. The designer line is a good observation but belongs in a longer essay, not a manifesto paragraph that needs to hit and move. It breaks the rhythm the first three sections built.

must_survive_line: Smoothness is the AI image that looks finished but was never begun.
